name: Discharge to Location and Date
description: The XDM data type is used to represent comprehensive discharge information including destination location, discharge date and time, and discharge disposition details. It provides structured information for tracking patient discharges from healthcare facilities, supporting care coordination, follow-up planning, and regulatory reporting requirements. XDM enables healthcare systems to maintain detailed discharge records essential for continuity of care and healthcare analytics.

XDM.1.name: Discharge to Location
XDM.1.description: The location where the patient is being discharged, such as home, skilled nursing facility, or another healthcare institution. Specifies the destination for care coordination and follow-up planning.

XDM.2.name: Discharge Date/Time
XDM.2.description: The specific date and time when the patient discharge occurred or is scheduled to occur. Critical for billing, bed management, and care coordination timing.

XDM.3.name: Discharge Disposition
XDM.3.description: The coded discharge disposition indicating the circumstances and outcome of the discharge (e.g., routine discharge, transfer, against medical advice). Essential for quality metrics and regulatory reporting.

constraints.locationValidation: Discharge location should be a valid healthcare facility or appropriate discharge destination
constraints.dateTimeValidation: Discharge date/time should be valid timestamp format and logically consistent with admission
constraints.dispositionCoding: Discharge disposition should use appropriate healthcare coding standards
